content:
Draft Revision No. 5 to Project Agreement No. 99-471-0015 Excess Equipment; Project No. 484-99-471
This amendment is issued to revise the estimated allocations made to the various recipients:
Part A: Counterpart deposit of funds allocated to the following non- revenue producing agencies is waived:
1. Public Works Bureau (PWB)
US$96,000
2. Civil Aeronautic Administration (CAA)
8,000
3. Provincial Health Administration (PHA)
1,000
4. Joint Commission on Rural Reconstruction (JORR)-
6,000
5. Vocational Assistance Commission for Retired
200
Servicemen (VACRS)
6. Tsing Hwa University
222.53
7. Provincial Education Department Sub-total
8,860 US$120,282.53
Part B: The funds allocated to the following agencies will be repaid in New Taiwan Dollars in accordance with the terms set forth below.
8. Taiwan Highway Bureau (THB)
52,000
9. BES Engineering Corporation (BES)
21,000
10. Kaohsiung Harbor Bureau (KsHB)
24,000
11. Keelung Harbor Bureau (KIHB)
55,000
12. Shihmen Development Commission (SDC)
31,000
13. Taiwan Power Company (TPC)
22,000
14. Ta Shu Shan Forestry Corporation (TSS)
100
15. Taipei Regional Water Supply Commission (TRWSC)
3,175
Sub-total
US$208,275
Total
US$328,557.53
Repayment Schedule:
Interest shall accrue at the rate of 5% per annum through 2/ from the date of the receipt of the first shipment by the recipient. Such accrued interest shall be added to the principal and the sum thereof shall become a new principal. The new principal shall be liquidated in 18 quarterly installments commencing one year after receipt of equipment. Each quarterly payment of principal and interest shall be computed on annuity basis at the interest rate of 5% per annum and an amortization period of 18 quarterly installments. Except for those specified above, standard terms of repayment are applicable.
Disposal of the balance of US$21,442.47 will be included in a further amendments to this agreement.
1/ Counterpart deposit will be required for the equipment which JCRR reallocates to revenue producing agencies.
2/ To be determined when the repayment starting date is definitely known.

D
ademia Historica
388

paragraphs.content: Draft Revision No. 5 to Project Agreement No. 99-471-0015 Excess Equipment; Project No. 484-99-471
This amendment is issued to revise the estimated allocations made to the various recipients:
Part A: Counterpart deposit of funds allocated to the following non- revenue producing agencies is waived:
Part B: The funds allocated to the following agencies will be repaid in New Taiwan Dollars in accordance with the terms set forth below.

Interest shall accrue at the rate of 5% per annum through 2/ from the date of the receipt of the first shipment by the recipient. Such accrued interest shall be added to the principal and the sum thereof shall become a new principal. The new principal shall be liquidated in 18 quarterly installments commencing one year after receipt of equipment. Each quarterly payment of principal and interest shall be computed on annuity basis at the interest rate of 5% per annum and an amortization period of 18 quarterly installments. Except for those specified above, standard terms of repayment are applicable.
Disposal of the balance of US$21,442.47 will be included in a further amendments to this agreement.
1/ Counterpart deposit will be required for the equipment which JCRR reallocates to revenue producing agencies.
2/ To be determined when the repayment starting date is definitely known.
